title: PropertyGuru IPO covered at the bottom of the range: book message
text:
ASX-aspirant PropertyGuru has told funds its initial public offering is covered at the bottom of the price range.

In a book message late on Tuesday night, PropertyGuru's brokers said:

Book continues to grow and is now covered with firm orders at the bottom of the range.

PropertyGuru's board is led by CEO Hari Krishnan. Bloomberg

While book messages get thrown around often during such share auctions, the use of the words “covered with firm orders” suggests the initial public offering is likely to get done.

Credit Suisse and UBS' equities desks opened the books to fund managers on Tuesday morning, having already taken bids for the retail broker offer.

The Asia-focused property listings business is seeking to raise $345 million to $380.2 million at $3.70 to $4.50 a security. If successful, the PropertyGuru securities will list on the ASX on Friday.
description: ASX-aspirant PropertyGuru has told funds its initial public offering is covered at the bottom of the price range.
